snippet: The landmark decision may cost the N.C.A.A. hundreds of millions of dollars, but it may not create a windfall for any individual athlete.
abstract: Q&A addresses landmark decision in the so-called O’Bannon case finding that NCAA violated antitrust laws and opening door for college athletes to be compensated.
lead_paragraph: The landmark decision may cost the N.C.A.A. hundreds of millions of dollars, but it may not create a windfall for any individual athlete.

headline.main: What the O’Bannon Ruling Means for Colleges and Players
headline.print_headline: What the Ruling Means for Colleges and Players
